ygData.subject: RE: EQ's intrusion into RL:  was RE: Re: Welp... it was me  :)
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, and lets not even talk about getting to know that one person and thinking you re falling in love... Insane?  That s just the start :) Hally ... From: Mike
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, and lets not even talk about getting to know that one person and
thinking you're falling in love...

Insane? That's just the start :)

Hally

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Roach [mailto:Mike.Roach@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 23, 2000 2:35 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: EQ's intrusion into RL: was RE: [eqbards] Re: Welp... it
was me :)


From: Mike Roach <Mike.Roach@...>

>
> So tell me, am I the only one?
>
> Tomerrilin
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: JasonF [mailto:jasonf@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 23, 2000 1:04 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Welp... it was me :)
>
>
> [46 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work
>

It takes me at least an hour to calm down after I log out of EQ, sometimes
longer. God forbid I have to do anything important or use my brain because
I wander around in this sort of EQ haze with half my reality stuck behind in
Norrath while I view the texturemaps of real life with strange awe and
confusion. I know some people who play EQ on their lunch breaks, I could
never pull this off and still manage to function in society.

I've been spending a LOT of time lower guk lately and every single time I
see an image of a frog in real life I slip off into a brief flashback sort
of muse and my eyes glaze over for a moment...then I snap back to reality
and /em chuckle.

Rest assured, we are all a bit insane because of this game.

-Faras
